ResourceHeader.ResourceName: All-sky auroral image taken by the Electron Auroral Imager 1 (EAI-1) at Syowa Station, Antarctica.
ResourceHeader.Description: Electron auroral image (557.7 nm for OI) in the JPEG format taken by the EAI-1 with a fish-eye lens at Syowa Station, Antarctica. The instrument is operated only during the winter season from the end of February to the middle of October).
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please contact the Principal Investigator, Dr. Akira Kadokura (kadokura [at] nipr.ac.jp), National Institute of Polar Research (NIPR) before using the data at any publications and/or presentations. We welcome collaborative research and strongly recommend users to contact us early in order to ensure that the data are suitable for their research. When the data are used at any publications and/or presentations, we would like to ask the users to acknowledge NIPR and send us one copy of the reprints. An example of the acknowledgement statement is as follows: "Aurora images were provided by National Institute of Polar Research, Japan. The auroral observation at Syowa Station was mainly supported by the Research Program of Japanese Antarctic Research Expedition (JARE) of the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology of Japan (MEXT)."
